pros: They claim to promote good values and to care about employees. And if you stay long enough, they might even give you a key chain or a hat or some ice cream.
cons:
Horrible pay. Horrible benefits. Little to no mentoring. Virtually impossible to advance. Over worked and constantly understaffed. Purported values are not enforced. And absolutely no job security. 

For all of these reasons, AHMG is a revolving door. There is talk about employee appreciation and career development but it's little more than occasional talk. With poor pay, poor benefits and little opportunity, folks are constantly leaving which only puts more burden on those that remain until they too leave. Only when enough people quit do they make slight adjustments but it's always too little too late. After watching these pointless battles continue year over year, one can only conclude this is their business plan/philosophy. 

Then add to it blindsided layoffs leading to a lack of trust or sense of security. Management may claim to be transparent but will lay folks off without the slightest warning - even after years and years of service.  Combine this with tremendous leadership turnover and chaos and it's just a mess.

job_title: Certified Medical Assistant in Oviedo, FL
pros: They really CARE about patient
cons: One organization in pro of the patient

review_title: Amazing growth opportunities, pay and benefits here!
job_title: Float Pool Supervisor in Leesburg, FL
pros:
1. I was recognized for my education, skills and experience upon hire and offered a larger pay rate than any competing companies.
2. I was given tools, training and resources to be my best in the field.
3. I was advised of available promotional positions to grow within the company. I was told ways that I could prepare myself for a leadership role and how to apply.
4. The company is caring and shows appreciation for it's staff. During a time when many companies were saying no to holiday bonuses. Advent gave out two separate checks!
5. The company is committed to quality care and I agree with all the core values. 
6. It feels good to make a difference and be recognized for it.
7. The company has been very helpful with navigating through this pandemic and has the safety of staff and patients at the forefront of their concerns.
8. Amazing experience all around. I truly feel and know that this is a great place to stay and grow.
cons: My only con would be that traveling to other offices a lot of providers have different needs and there is not a set resource for all practices or set standard operating procedure with some aspects. However with such a large company and the amount of practices I am sure this would be a difficult task to prepare such a tool.

pros: The best reason is networking.
cons: The new ceo doesn’t listen and is all about her self

pros: I love the culture here! People aren't perfect of course, but interactions are almost always positive & constructive. Best place I've ever worked!
cons: It's a large company, so sometimes hard to know who to ask questions of to get an issue resolved.

pros: i love the fact i was able to go to school and move up in the company was well
cons: im just struggling to pass my test but i will get it

job_title: Certified Medical Assistant (CMA) in Tavares, FL
pros: I have been welcomed by everyone in my office, HR, and corporate. AdventHealth makes sure you are well prepared to start your job after orientation. AdventHealth offers tuition assistants and a career ladder to further your career. You have the chance to be a preceptor to help train students in medical assistant school too.
cons: No employee uniform incentive for new hires. Only wearing one uniform color would be nice if we could wear a few different colors.

review_title: It’s not WHAT you know it’s WHO you know.
job_title: Front Desk Receptionist in Orlando, FL
pros: Flexible hours, great coworkers that turn from friends into family, great discount programs, and awesome credit union, lots of resources ALN programs and an awesome team to provide spiritual services to pray and be prayed for.
cons: High turnover, little to no training, no yearly reviews to compensate your title to what you actually do. Processes and procedures do not exist, no accountability, some managers depend on other staff to step up and work in different areas which is good bc your cross training however what starts as help ends up being adding to your already too much list of responsibilites. And bc of the high turnover and lack of staff/training people transfer to different positions and roles to continue the same cycle. It’s like you have to pick your poison. The fact that the patient can get upset and insult you and we keep our composure but still keep them as patients who keeps us safe when there is no security at all is beyond me.

cons: Even though it may have taken them a few months to get back to me , I stood patiently and waited.(keep in mind in covid times things have shifted a lot in each department they have less staff in some places so a lot of applications were over flooding about 300,000 and that's for all over Central Florida and they wanted to be as professional as possible and give everyone one a chance. )

pros: Depending on the practice, you may work with good people around you. Depending on the practice you may get a good manager.
cons: Many of the people that work here in Orlando especially, are rude to staff and patients. The pay is very low for all the work they want you to perform. They put their money into little nick nacks, instead of providing their employees that have been here a while bonus pays that their employees will benefit more from to feed their families. Employees are stretched very thin and are expected to be great team members and great providers with many changes to constantly adjust too, a revolving door of employees, which lead practices to be understaffed and the employees who stay are expected to jump in, but because of numbers, they may not pay you more. It doesn't matter how long you have contributed to the company.

pros: Great leadership and good benefits
cons: None at this time, thanks

pros: coworkers, physicians ( if you're lucky, you can meet some amazing doctors who are passionate about what they do), events, discounts. Depending on where you work, one can have a wonderful experience. Other places not so much. As you continue to grow, you'll start to see everything for what it really is.
cons: All about s.a.m.o.a.s.( money, money, money). Adventhealth has enough money to build other departments, bring state of the art medical equipment, and have tv/social media advertisement. But they don't have the money for raises nor do they support their staff who do not have a piece of paper to grow within the company. There is definitely a differential pay between males and females. If you "bark" to loud about your complaints about simple suggestions for improvement, beware. They will monitor you like a hawk. Adventhealth does not like employees creating a "show".
